entry.title: ime: Ensure SetCompositionText is called if text selected
entry.content:
In the special case where (1) there is no composition and (2) there is a

non-empty selection, calling SetCompositionText should delete the

selection, even when the call would otherwise be considered redundant.

For example, calling SetCompositionText('') when there is no composition

seems like it would have no effect, but it does if there is a non-empty

selection, so we make sure it is called in such cases. See b/223500609.



Change-Id: If8f5e082f512c449cbeb0298619a4f74cb062cc9

entry.title: Reland: "Fix URL parser to allow "%00" as a valid URL path"
entry.content:
This is a reland of 69e46942563b30be8a79512252e92fcf00c1a522.



The previous CL was reverted because it did not include the necessary

rebaselines.



The difference from the reverted CL is:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676974/1..2



I2S is:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/e1XDduDDM9w/



Original change's description:

> Fix URL parser to allow "%00" as a valid URL path

>

> This CL is part of the URL interop 2023 effort.

>

> The problem:

>

> Chrome currently considers a URL invalid if the URL's path part

> contains "%00" (or null), which is not compliant with the URL Standard

> [1]. For example, the following test fails in Chrome because new

> URL(..) throws an Invalid URL exception.

>

> assertEquals(new URL("http://example.com/%00").pathname, "/%00");

>

> According to the URL Standard, any character or byte sequence in URL

> path should not make the URL invalid.

>

> Interoperability:

>

> - Chrome is the only non-compliant browser, while Firefox and Safari

> are compliant.

> - I have also tested URL APIs in non-browser environments and

> libraries, such as Deno's `URL` implementation [2] and Rust's `url`

> crate [3], both of which accept "%00" as a valid URL.

>

> History:

>

> This behavior seems to be a result of past decisions. The comment in

> `url_canon_path.cc` states:

>

> > // This table was used to be designed to match exactly what IE did

> > // with the characters.

>

> This CL updates the table so that "%00" in URL's path is no longer

> considered invalid. Further updates to the table will be addressed as

> another issue (https://crbug.com/1252531).

>

> Note that this CL only affects the URL's path. In other parts of URL,

> "%00" may still be considered invalid. For example,

>

> new URL("http://example%00.com/";)

>

> throws an exception because "%00" is not a valid host codepoint.

>

> Tests:

>

> Updating this behavior requires modifying existing web tests and unit

> tests that rely on Chrome's non-compliant behavior.

>

> Some usages of "%00" in unit tests can be replaced with any invalid

> URL because their purpose is to represent an invalid URL, such as

> "https://example[invalid].com/";.

>

> Additionally, some tests can be removed since a URL is never invalid

> due to its path part after this CL.

>

> As for WPT tests, all rebaseline are generated using `git cl

> rebaseline`, and no manual updates were made to expectation files.

> Most rebaselines are understandable, and many WPT tests are now

> passing.

>

> The impacts:

>

> A URL path can now include "%00". This may raise concerns.

>

> For websites, how to handle "%00" in the URL's path is up-to each

> website. Since they can receive such a URL from other clients than

> Chrome, this is not a new issue for most websites.

>

> In term of implementation, web-exported URL APIs, GURL, and KURL share

> the same URL parser and canonicalization backend. Another concern is

> likely related to Chromium's internal code, which many assume that a

> valid URL never contains "%00" in its path.

>

> After this CL, that assumption is no longer true. If necessary,

> Chromium's internal code needs to handle NULL in some way when

> percent-decoding the URL's path for specific reasons. For example,

> this CL updates `FileURLToFilePath` function defined in

> `filename_util.cc` so that NULL is handled in this layer.

>

> It is challenging to assess every code path like this since URLs are

> widely used, and there may be "Unknown Unknowns". Any ideas on how to

> confidently land this CL without causing any breakages are welcome. If

> you encounter a null pointer dereference crash and find this CL in the

> regression range, this CL might be a culprit.

>

> - [1] https://url.spec.whatwg.org/

> - [2] https://deno.land/api@v1.34.3?s=URL

> - [3] https://docs.rs/url/latest/url/

>

> Bug: 1400251

> Change-Id: Ic2c774835e68f835ff5c9c7e881b6ad6847d17b1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4596360

> Reviewed-by: Orin Jaworski

> Reviewed-by: Ryan Hamilton

> Reviewed-by: David Dorwin

> Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Reviewed-by: Maxim Kolosovskiy

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1168519}

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in ConnectTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.

entry.title: PA: Rename bucket distributions
entry.content:
This CL is trivial. This CL renames

`PartitionRoot::BucketDistribution::kDefault` to `kNeutral` and removes

some allusions to "alternate" bucket distributions.



`kNeutral` is in contrast to `kDenser` and to the deprecated `kCoarser`

(see https://crrev.com/c/4373791). `kDefault` is a less descriptive

name, as it only describes the starting state of PartitionAlloc.

Clients can optionally switch to the denser distribution.



Because of the prevalance of the `kDenser` distribution (non-browser

processes and 32-bit Android excepted), the "default" designation is

best left to higher levels, e.g. `partition_alloc_features`.



This CL does not touch the (now defunct) feature flag infrastructure.



Memo: server-side config was removed in revision 530243413.



Bug: 1238858

Change-Id: I89b5b14b0d024ee9cdfce9e904b6f8faf911f235

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710168

entry.title: [LCPP] Read-path test: ElementLocator matching <img>s priority bumed to VeryHigh
entry.content:
This CL adds a test case for the read path added in https://crrev.com/c/4672510



The test html is

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/lcp_critical_path_predictor/prioritize_lcp_image.php

, but it requires the following test infra changes to run:

- NonAssociatedWebTestControlHost mojom binding so it can be accessed

from mojo JS binding. Context: discussion at

https://chromium.slack.com/archives/CGGGVPSQ4/p1688601297545099

- WebTestContentBrowserClient injects LCPP hint at

`DidStartNavigation` if it was supplied via

NonAssociatedWebTestControlHost.

- BUILD.gn files are modified so that they will generate

wire format protos used for testing from text protos.

- `lcpp` VirtualTestSuite is added, since the test require the

LCPCriticalPathPredictor feature flag to be enabled until the

feature is unflagged.



Bug: 1419756

entry.content:
This reverts commit 2a95130f5be09a6d7f8a2bd003d7e27235643fcd.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8774647131045309121



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8774647131045309121



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8774647131045309121&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4708471

entry.title: shortcuts: Detect reserved accelerators
entry.content:
Reserved accelerators are a subset of accelerators that are not

displayed in the Shortcuts app because it either:

1. Is part of a text-based accelerator that captures multiple

accelerators (e.g. Ctrl 1-8 to select tab)

2. Is a singular accelerator with a complex instruction to

activate (e.g. alt + tab's instructions)



This subset can also be furthered expanded to protect certain

accelerators from being used in customization (e.g. admin request).



Bug: b/216049298

Test: ash_webui_unittests

entry.title: Don't apply v4/v6 IP address mapping when evaluating name constraints
entry.content:
net::IPAddressMatchesPrefix internally maps between v4-mapped v6

addresses, but we don't want to apply those when evaluating IP name

constraints. The mapped and normal addresses are different origins and

all. They're just an internal routing trick for v6 networks.



When we remove the net::IPAddress dependency, we'll, replace this with

something that doesn't apply this in the first place. In the meantime,

just check the sizes match.



Fixed: 1467353

entry.title: shortcuts: Delay only when firing update
entry.content:
* There are two scenarios that will trigger the endCapture() function:

- case 1: The input area loses focus.

- case 2: An update event is fired.

We should only add a 300ms delay specifically for the second

scenario.



* Additionally, we modify the onCancelButtonClicked so that clicking

the cancel button will also invoke the endCapture function.

entry.title: [ios] NTP Mediator shutdown cleanup
entry.content:
This change does several things related to NTPMediator's shutdown:

* marks its reference to ContentSuggestionsMediator as weak, clarifying

that NTPMediator does not own this other mediator

* removes the call to ContentSuggestionsMediator's disconnect, since it

is called by the ContentSuggestionsCoordinator's stop method

* moves all of NTPMediator's "cleanup" code into shutdown, rather than

have it split / duplicated between shutdown and dealloc

* NTPMediator's dealloc is now used to verify that shutdown has

happened



This should result in a very small code coverage % increase, since the

logic in dealloc wasn't covered previously.



Bug: 1464692

Change-Id: I306cdbafc38c8b664702c4e69808d2a375d35a93

entry.title: [Office upload] Close progress notification before complete notification
entry.content:
All notifications created by the CloudUploadNotificationManager have the

same |notification_id_|. Each new notification is displayed without closing the existing one. This leads to the weird behaviour of the spacing of the complete notification, which follows the progress notifications, to be too large.



By closing the last progress notification before displaying

the complete notification, the spacing of the complete notification is

as expected.



Note: this is a quick fix and does not guarantee the spacing of the

other notifications to be fixed. A better fix will be implemented in

b/292449105.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Bc5j8A9axmKtaZP.png

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3UAHm5iZShswsL8.png



Bug: b/292433845

entry.title: Support third-party origin trials of CompressionDictionaryTransport
entry.content:
Currently, the CompressionDictionaryTransport feature can only be

enabled by first-party Origin Trial tokens. However, supporting

third-party Origin Trial is very useful for running experiments.

Therefore, this CL sets the `origin_trial_allows_third_party` property

in `runtime_enabled_features.json5`.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Fix tab close positioning on small tabs
entry.content:
The tab close button was being right justified even in the small tab

scenario. This is because it was measured based on the actual size of

the close button instead of the visible size. fixing this means the

tab close button will be centered when the tab is small.

entry.title: [UIA] Expose all text fields as 'edit', not email, telephone or url
entry.content:
The UIA localized control type was set to "email", "telephone" and "url"

for , and ,

respectively. This means that UIA ATs like Narrator were announcing

those text fields as "email", without mentioning its editable state.



Furthermore, authors will often set the accessible name of these text

fields to something that will specify its expected format anyway, so there was a lot of double speak according to screen reader users.



This CL replaces the localized control type for these text fields to

simply 'edit'. It brings the announcements made by Narrator on par with

the announcements made by JAWS and NVDA on Windows.



Change-Id: I11f736aaa0bc179cf9687ce30dacb93446321141

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713349

entry.title: Update file type icons.
entry.content:
This CL updates file type icons to match foundation library:



http://shortn/_09g2UY2oyd



Note that this effectively standardizes internal padding of icons

but does not otherwise change their appearance.



As a result of this change, icons of a given size (e.g. 20x20) will

appear slightly larger due to reduced internal padding. As a (positive)

side effect of this change, icons can be displayed at smaller sizes

before antialiasing begins to cause icons to appear blurred/fuzzy.



See use in demo below showing improved icon clarity.



Demo*: http://shortn/_jwcuW3y8Kc



* Nested clipboard submenu uses new icons, standalone clipboard menu

shows old icons on left, new icons on right for demo purposes.



Screenshots:

* http://shortn/_CLormFtDYh

* http://shortn/_gLbLVbiTK9

* http://shortn/_LI9HL5xTr4

entry.title: Remove min overscroll event delta check
entry.content:
There doesn't seem to be spec describing how the deltas should be set

and Safari and Firefox don't seem to support the overscroll event yet

(per my manual test using this codepen[1] and wpt.fyi[2]) so there

doesn't really seem to be a reason to enforce a check on the minimum

delta in each and every overscroll event.

For example, before this patch, if there was extra scrolling input

of 300px causing overscroll events with with individiual deltas of 48, 102, and 150, we could fire overscroll event with cumulative deltas of 48, 150 and 300 the test would fail because the first event had 48 (<50). The events report the cumulative deltas[3], not the individual values.



It does seem reasonable to keep the check that the maximum overscroll

is reasonably close to and not greater than the excess amount of

scroll input.



[1]https://codepen.io/awogbemila/pen/eYQVWrL

[2]https://wpt.fyi/results/dom/events/scrolling/overscroll-deltas.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned

[3]https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/71d03067cf95b8c8f42fd74c7334654e2a39639f:cc/input/input_handler.cc;l=1865



Bug: 1430215

Change-Id: I891711f346d6f0cd8c3b423c0a2e8d141c6dec6a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4690405

entry.title: Android: Improve preferred dep handling
entry.content:
Previously the first missing dep in the list of missing deps was used.

This CL uses the newly refactored dep_utils.py to scan

.build_config.json files and find the preferred dep instead (if any).

This improves the accuracy of the added deps (makes it easier to

automate) at the cost of speed, each missing dep now takes 20+ seconds

(when parallelized) to process. That will be addressed in a future CL.

a parameter so that backing can use it.

entry.title: Support dictionary load from subresources link headers
entry.content:
Currently, the dictionary link HTTP header only works for document

resources. This is because the `is_dictionary_load_allowed` flag is only

set to true when PreloadHelper::LoadLinksFromHeader() is processing the

link HTTP header of document resources. However, we should support

dictionary loading from subresource link HTTP headers.



To do this, this CL changes PreloadHelper::LoadLinksFromHeader() to also

enable `is_dictionary_load_allowed` when processing the link HTTP header

of subresources.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I5d0ee5f0300c060a8fc540b01d8e86d46bcb808d

There is an in process effort (see WIP[1] as reference) that makes

toolbar buttons overflow to a chevron button as the browser window

width gets smaller than usual.



To display the overflowed buttons in chevron menu we need to query

which ones are hidden by layout_manager in a newly added controller

class. Thus we need to expose this function to all classes.

entry.content:
Previously the image processor was setup with a |relative_rotation|

parameter to handle situations where an image would be rotated such as

on a tablet. Proper video rotation was never achieved in frame encoding.



Updates the ImageProcessor and all components that reference it to

remove the rotation parameter as it is a technical debt.



and Asurada boards.

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Fix notification behavior for Lacros tab fullscreen
entry.content:
There are two types of fullscreen, browser fullscreen (where the whole

browser is fullscreen), and tab fullscreen (where an element on the web

page requests fullscreen). Before this patch, the behavior of browser

fullscreen downloads is that we show an exclusive access bubble with

wording instructing the user to exit fullscreen to view their downloads,

and then show the partial view upon exiting fullscreen. When not in

immersive fullscreen mode, tab fullscreen should work the same way.

However, this was not working properly in tab fullscreen on Lacros,

where the exclusive access bubble was not being shown.



The issue was that we were passing an empty GURL to the exclusive access

context, which signifies browser (immersive on ChromeOS) fullscreen.

Since we always pass an empty GURL when notify_download is true, the

fix in this CL is to modify the logic in BrowserView so that the check

for a non-empty URL is skipped for notify_download == true. The logic

for immersive fullscreen is handled already by the download controller

anyway.



Also adds interactive UI tests for both browser and tab fullscreen.



Bug: 1361511

Change-Id: I9ac08ba46a60474db445d15e2394a8cc045ee531

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4652317

entry.title: Create `AppListSyncableService::OnFirstSync()` API.
entry.content:
The new API registers a callback to be run from a posted task on

completion of the first sync in the session. The callback is notified

of whether the first sync in the session was thought to be the first

sync ever across all ChromeOS devices and sessions for the associated

user.



This API will be used by user education features as the primary signal

for identifying "new" users. If and only if this callback is run with

`was_first_sync_ever == true` will a user be considered "new". If this

signal is not received, we will fallback to a more conservative

assumption that the user is *not* "new".

entry.title: Add UMA metrics for total cookie jar size and avg/max size per key
entry.content:
By "size" of a cookie jar, we mean the sum of the sizes of the cookie

names and values in bytes.



These metrics will give us insight on how much memory sites need for

their cookies and will also let us compare the memory impact of CHIPS

to partitioned cookies.

entry.title: Fix edge case in Push Notification client user action logging
entry.content:
The user action metrics are missing some edge cases e.g. notification

tap when the app is closed (which means the URL loading is delayed

until the app is loaded). Also, when a bookmark isn't found

when the user clicks 'Untrack price'. The user action logging

should be executed immediately after the conditionals which detect

the user actions to ensure no edge cases are missed.

entry.title: Refresh top teacher assignment submission status
entry.content:
When fetching teacher assignments, add logic to refresh submissions

state for assignments that end up being shown in the UI, even if the

course work due/update date would allow using cached state from previous

fetch requests.

Given that whether an assignment is a "top" item is unknown until other

assignment state is fetched, this check is done after the teacher data

is fetched, but before responding to GetTeacher*Assignments calls. If

submissions data needs to be fetched for some course work, the fetch

state is reset, and callback is delayed until extra data gets fetched.

Any other pending teacher data callback is put on hold too, until the

required course work info is refreshed.



Adds hooks to avoid refetching data if the pending assignments request

callback is no longer valid, to avoid blocking other pending callbacks

unnecessarily.



BUG=b:283371186



Change-Id: I3d7bdf8349094c3c3e73ee314c15498008fd022c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4706800

Reviewed-by: Artsiom Mitrokhin

entry.title: shortcuts: Fix the AshAcceleratorsNotInAllowedListShouldHaveLayouts test
entry.content:
We're passing too a lot of false positives. For example,

AcceleratorAction::kLaunchApp7 does not have an associated layout but

it's still being passed in the tests.



The reason for this is because we have two sets of enums in

kAcceleratorLayouts:

- AcceleratorAction (ash)

- NonConfigurableActions (non-ash)



They have overlapped enum values. Since the kAcceleratorData contains

only ash accelerators, we should filter the kAcceleratorLayouts by only

mojom::AcceleratorSource::kAsh.



Bug: b/216049298

Test: ash_unittests --gtest_filter=AcceleratorLayoutMetadataTest*

Change-Id: I05c11c62d6eda7191ac96e343abc3b62bc46e0ed

entry.title: [EditContext] Remove inputMode, inputPanelPolicy, enterKeyHint attributes
entry.content:
The following properties exist on the EditContext IDL but are not in

the spec:

- EditContext.inputMode

- EditContext.inputPanelPolicy

- EditContext.enterKeyHint



All three of these now also exist as global attributes on HTMLElement,

so instead of supporting them on EditContext we can instead have

EditContext use the value on the currently focused element, like

how things already work for normal editable elements.



This way, the author can control the value of these by setting the

attributes on the DOM element being edited rather than through

the EditContext itself.



Bug: 999184

Change-Id: I50150bac20cf7448e28e36501f00a6de717e0680

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698578

entry.title: Settings: Migrate tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest, part 3.
entry.content:
In this part migrating Gtests triggering the following Mocha test files:

- all_sites_test.ts

- privacy_guide_fragments_test.js

- privacy_guide_integration_test.js

- privacy_guide_page_test.ts

- security_page_test.ts



As part of the migration test names have been slightly renamed to better

fit in the simpler naming scheme used in settings_browsertest.cc



WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.

entry.title: [remoting host] Remove mojo util
entry.content:
MojoIpcz adoption for Windows has been completed, and I have verified

that the Mac host still works after enabling MojoIpcz. I haven't

verified ChromeOS, but MojoIpcz has not been enabled globally on CrOS

anyway, so we can't verify it yet. There are no CRD-internal IPCs on

CrOS, so it probably won't be us fixing any MojoIpcz problems on CrOS,

if there's any.



Given this, this CL just removes the mojo util, which was basically

used to disable MojoIpcz on Windows and Mac.
